TrainDirectionMethod trainDirectionMethod
 Variable containing the actual method used to obtain the conjugate gradient train direction.
TrainRateMethod trainRateMethod
 Variable containing the actual method used to obtain a suitable train rate.

Detailed Description

This concrete class represents a conjugate gradient training algorithm for an objective functional of a multilayer perceptron.

See also:
TrainingAlgorithm.

Definition at line 32 of file ConjugateGradient.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

Flood::ConjugateGradient::ConjugateGradient ( ObjectiveFunctional *  newObjectiveFunctional  ) 

General constructor. It creates a conjugate gradient training algorithm object associated to an objective functional object. It also initializes the class members to their default values:

Training operators:

  • Train direction method = Polak-Ribiere;
  • Train rate method = Brent;

Training parameters:

  • First train rate: 1.0.
  • Bracketing factor: 2.0.
  • Train rate tolerance: 1.0e-3.

Stopping criteria:

  • Evaluation goal: -1.0e99.
  • Gradient norm goal: 0.0.
  • Maximum training time: 1.0e6.
  • Maximum number of epochs: 100.

User stuff:

  • Warning train rate: 1.0e6.
  • Error train rate: 1.0e12.
  • Display: true.
  • Display period: 25.

Reserve:

  • Reserve training direction history: false.
  • Reserve training direction norm history: false.
  • Reserve training rate history: false.

Parameters:
newObjectiveFunctional Pointer to an objective functional object.
See also:
TrainingAlgorithm.

Definition at line 75 of file ConjugateGradient.cpp.

Flood::ConjugateGradient::ConjugateGradient ( void   ) 

Default constructor. It creates a conjugate gradient training algorithm object not associated to any objective functional object. It also initializes the class members to their default values:

Training operators:

  • Train direction method = Polak-Ribiere;
  • Train rate method = Brent;

Training parameters:

  • First train rate: 1.0.
  • Bracketing factor: 2.0.
  • Train rate tolerance: 1.0e-3.

Stopping criteria:

  • Evaluation goal: -1.0e99.
  • Gradient norm goal: 0.0.
  • Maximum training time: 1.0e6.
  • Maximum number of epochs: 100.

User stuff:

  • Warning train rate: 1.0e6.
  • Error train rate: 1.0e12.
  • Display: true.
  • Display period: 25.

Reserve:

  • Reserve training direction history: false.
  • Reserve training direction norm history: false.
  • Reserve training rate history: false.

See also:
TrainingAlgorithm.

double Flood::ConjugateGradient::calculateGoldenSectionTrainRate ( double  initialTrainRate,
double  evaluation,
Vector< double >  freeParameters,
Vector< double >  trainDirection 
) [private]

This method returns the train rate by searching in a given direction to locate the minimum of the objective function in that direction. It uses the golden section method.

Parameters:
initialTrainRate Initial train rate in line minimization.
evaluation Network's evaluation value.
freeParameters Network's free parameters vector.
trainDirection Train direction vector.
See also:
calculateBrentMethodTrainRate(double, double, Vector<double>, Vector<double>).

train(void).

void Flood::ConjugateGradient::setTrainingDirectionHistory ( Matrix< double >  newTrainingDirectionHistory  ) 

This method sets a new matrix containing the training direction history over the training epochs. Each row in the matrix contains the training direction vector of one single epoch.

Parameters:
newTrainingDirectionHistory Training direction history matrix.

void Flood::ConjugateGradient::train ( void   )  [virtual]

This method trains a multilayer perceptron with an associated evaluation function according to the conjugate gradient algorithm. Training occurs according to the training parameters.

See also:
TrainDirectionMethod.

TrainRateMethod.

Implements Flood::TrainingAlgorithm.

void Flood::ConjugateGradient::print ( void   )  [virtual]

This method prints to the screen the train direction and the operators chosen for training, the training parameters, the stopping criteria and other user stuff concerning the conjugate gradient object:

Training operators:

  • Train direction method.
  • Train rate method.

Training parameters:

  • Initial train rate.
  • Train rate tolerance.

Stopping criteria:

  • Evaluation goal.
  • Gradient norm goal.
  • Maximum training time.
  • Maximum number of epochs.

User stuff:

  • Warning train rate.
  • Error train rate.
  • Display.
  • Display period.
  • Reserve elapsed time history.
  • Reserve free parameters history.
  • Reserve free parameters norm history.
  • Reserve evaluation history.
  • Reserve gradient history.
  • Reserve gradient norm history.
  • Reserve training direction history.
  • Reserve training direction norm history
  • Reserve training rate history

Implements Flood::TrainingAlgorithm.

void Flood::ConjugateGradient::load ( char *  filename  )  [virtual]

This method loads a conjugate gradient object from a data file. Please mind about the file format, wich is specified in the User's Guide.

Training operators:

  • Train direction method.
  • Train rate method.

Training parameters:

  • First train rate.
  • Train rate tolerance.

Stopping criteria:

  • Evaluation goal.
  • Gradient norm goal.
  • Maximum training time.
  • Maximum number of epochs.

  • Warning train rate.
  • Error train rate.

  • Reserve free parameters history.
  • Reserve free parameters norm history.
  • Reserve evaluation history.

  • Reserve gradient norm history.

  • Reserve training rate history.

void Flood::ConjugateGradient::resizeTrainingHistory ( int  newSize  ) 

This method resizes the vectors or matrices containing training history information to a new size:

  • Elapsed time history vector.
  • Free parameters history matrix.
  • Free parameters norm history vector.
  • Evaluation history vector.
  • Gradient history matrix.
  • Gradient norm history vector.
  • Training direction history matrix.
  • Training direction norm history vector
  • Training rate history vector.

Parameters:
newSize Size of training history.
